alert.note: Alert for Jay (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Jay County through 415 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Portland, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Jay County, including the following locations... Westchester, College Corner, Boundary City, Liber, Trinity, Collett, New Corydon, Bluff Point, Salamonia and Brice. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
